img.alt: CPIE Small Business of the Year

img.aside: Your Future...Our Mission. Imagine the Possibilities!

div.div: The mission of Valdosta City Schools is quality teaching and learning, resulting in superior performance for all.
Our vision is to prepare students to pursue infinite possibilities for the future.

h1.a: Valdosta High School Head Football Coach Named

section.p: Welcome to Wildcat Nation Coach Rush Propst!

What: VBOE Video Conference Regular Meeting
When: Tuesday, 4/14/2020, 7:00 PM
Where: Video Conference (VCS Facebook Live)

What: Valdosta Recruiting Webinar & ACT Prep
When: 4/23/2020, 6:00 PM
Where: Zoom Webinar
Who: Athletes and Parents

Valdosta City Schools has been mandated by the Governor to physically close for the remainder of the year because of the coronavirus pandemic, COVID-19. Unfortunately, we are unable to offer electronic devices for checkout to K – 5 students. At this time we cannot ensure the equitable distribution of devices to all K – 5 students. Additionally, we cannot ensure all students will have equal or equitable access to home Internet connection.

h1.a: Students Receive Honors from National Garden Club State Youth Contests

section.p: Congratulations to our students who participated and received awards in the National Garden Club State Youth Poetry and Sculpture Contests sponsored by our local Valdosta Garden Club.
Thank-you Students, Parents and Staff for being patient as information has evolved through these unprecedented times. Please see below for important updates about the AP Exam:

h1.a: VHS Students Named Governor’s Honors Program Finalists

section.p: Governor’s Honors Program (GHP) 2020 finalists have been announced by the Governor’s Office of Student Achievement. Of nine nominees from Valdosta City Schools, three exceptional students were selected as finalists and two as alternates.

h1.a: Georgia Department of Education Receives Federal Assessment Waiver; Other COVID-19 Updates

section.p: April 7, 2020 – Georgia has received formal approval from the federal government to waive testing and accountability requirements for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, State School Superintendent Richard Woods announced today. No state testing – including Georgia Milestones EOGs and EOCs, GAA 2.0, and GKIDS – will be administered in Georgia for the rest of the school year. Additionally, there will not be a 2020 CCRPI.
